alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Chouteau (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Chouteau and northeastern Cascade Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 528 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Great Falls, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Belt, Black Eagle, Portage, Malmstrom Afb, Sand Coulee, Stockett, Tracy and Centerville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 272 and 289. Highway 87 between mile markers 4 and 18. Highway 89 between mile markers 73 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and north central Montana.
